Posted By: thaviel (6/4/2009 4:11:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The [Crab Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crab Umbra) was made for this guy, pretty much.  
Imagine this situation: You've just begun your turn with a [Kamahl, Pit Fighter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kamahl, Pit Fighter) on the board enchanted with a Crab Umbra, while your opponent's got [Grizzly Bears](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grizzly Bears) and [Wild Griffin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Griffin) on his side of the table. You skip your main phase since you've got no cards in your hand at the moment, and go on straight to the combat phase. Before you declare attackers you tap Kamahl and kill his Griffin, and then you pay (2)(U) to activate the Umbra's ability and untap Kamahl. You then proceed to tap Kamahl once again and kill his Bears, and then you activate the Umbra for the second time, untap Kamahl, and finally proceed to go on to swing for 6 with Kamahl on your opponent. So in the end you paid (4)(U)(U) to gain board advantage and seriously damage your opponent, all while Kamahl was hidden safely behind the Umbra's Totem Armor. Sounds like a good deal to me.
posts.html:

You skip your main phase since you've got no cards in your hand at the moment, and go on straight to the combat phase. Before you declare attackers you tap Kamahl and kill his Griffin, and then you pay (2)(U) to activate the Umbra's ability and untap Kamahl. You then proceed to tap Kamahl once again and kill his Bears, and then you activate the Umbra for the second time, untap Kamahl, and finally proceed to go on to swing for 6 with Kamahl on your opponent. So in the end you paid (4)(U)(U) to gain board advantage and seriously damage your opponent, all while Kamahl was hidden safely behind the Umbra's Totem Armor. Sounds like a good deal to me.

Posted By: Tiggurix (6/11/2010 2:37:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great for a burn deck. You can usually clear the board with burn before dropping him (especially now that Earthquake is back) and if you can't you can always use him to help remove any trouble creatures once he is in play. A creature that casts [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) each turn is hard to beat, especially when you have your own burn to back it up. If the board is clear, then swing for six. Since the return of [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt), anything with less than four toughness is going to be removed by burn fairly easily.  
  
It's also cool they reprinted him in the same core set along with [Phage the Untouchable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phage the Untouchable). All they needed to do was reprint [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath) instead of [Cho-Manno, Revolutionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cho-Manno, Revolutionary) and the old party crew would have been back together.
posts.html:
Great for a burn deck. You can usually clear the board with burn before dropping him (especially now that Earthquake is back) and if you can't you can always use him to help remove any trouble creatures once he is in play. A creature that casts Lightning Bolt each turn is hard to beat, especially when you have your own burn to back it up. If the board is clear, then swing for six. Since the return of Lightning Bolt, anything with less than four toughness is going to be removed by burn fairly easily.

It's also cool they reprinted him in the same core set along with Phage the Untouchable. All they needed to do was reprint Akroma, Angel of Wrath instead of Cho-Manno, Revolutionary and the old party crew would have been back together.
